intro: Scaphosepalum tarantula, commonly known as the Tarantula orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that resemble tarantulas, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange with a distinctive, elongated spur that houses the nectar. Scaphosepalum tarantula is appreciated for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
